result.execSummary:
All charges against Charles Daniel Williams in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles Daniel Williams is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Dolfi. kma
JOC & ARIPR returned by PO. Return to sender. No such street. Unable to forward. Filed in 21CF937 and 22CF08.olg
Signed by Def and Atty. km

9:12 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson,  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Charles Daniel Williams, Defendant Charles Daniel Williams in court. INCLUDES 21CF937, 21TR4274 and 22CF08. ADA Becker recites agreement. DE sworn. WOPH: Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DE has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Becker is filing Information at this time, it will mirror the complaint. PLEAS: State moves to amend Ct 2 in 21CF937 to remove modifier. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Felony Bail Jumping and amended Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct WITHOUT modifier in 21CF937. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Felony Bail Jumping and amended Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct WITHOUT modifier in 21CF937. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 3 in 21CF937 and cases 21TR4274 and 22CF08 in their entirety. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 9:41 AM. kma

Court orders: 
Ct 1 - Felony Bail Jumping
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months conditional jail - STAYED
- Complete domestic violence assessment and follow recommendation treatment
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court

Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct
I/S 60 days jail
1 year probation with conditions:
- Complete domestic violence assessment and follow recommendation treatment
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Defendant to report to probation today. 
10 days jail credit in the event of revocation.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved for balance.

2:34 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Charles Daniel Williams. Defendant Charles Daniel Williams not in court. Set for PTC. Court reviews case. Atty Dolfi states DE is probably not going to make it as DE is currently sitting in stopped traffic. ADA Becker states all discovery has been provided and there is a possible global resolution with all cases. Court is okay with Branch 1 hearing. Atty Dolfi confirms address. Court sets STC with Branch I. Adjourned 02:44 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues. Court confirms address. Adjourned 08:49 AM  Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Charles Daniel Williams appeared. Case called at 1:40 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a return on warrant. DE states he showed up late for last court appearance.  Court will QUASH WARRANT. Bond reinstated. Preliminary hearing is scheduled. Address confirmed.

Return on warrant on April 8, 2022 at 01:05 pm.

10:17 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: Charles Daniel Williams did not appear. Court reviews case. Set for PH. Atty Dolfi does not know DE's whereabouts. ADA Becker requests warrant. Court issues warrant- stayed until 04/08/22 at 1:00 PM. Court sets PH if DE appears on 04/08/22.
